definition: To flow or trickle down in a continuous and gentle manner, often used to describe the movement of a liquid substance. It is commonly used to refer to the action of a substance slowly seeping or dripping downwards, typically in a natural or uncontrolled manner.

examples.german: Die Milch rann aus dem Glas.
examples.english: The milk ran out of the glass.

examples.german: Das Wasser rann den Berg hinunter.
examples.english: The water ran down the mountain.

examples.german: Die Tränen rannen über ihr Gesicht.
Das Blut rann aus der Wunde.
Der Schweiß rann ihm über die Stirn.
